about this!

'being easy to do business with', they can pre-read Part I of our ITT
document on the London2012 website. Previously, we provided the
following link:

the new ITT Part I is stored - could you please let us know? Also, there
were several links within the .pdf that will no longer work - these will
need to be reinstated with the appropriate new links.

 

This is a matter of some urgency, as suppliers will be trying to read
this document as we speak!

 

Any questions do let me know, thanks,

 

Ru

By "tags" we mean only free-form tags, of the kind that are typed in as comma-separated values in the "Tags" input. Other metadata fields are not tags, and are not handled in the tag management UI. It's important everybody over there understand this or you're likely to get odd results where tags are "not working"!

The theme metadata field is autocompleted from a fixed taxonomy. We can change the value stored in the taxonomy, but this will not change existing values. Let us know if you want these old values changed retrospectively.

Alex

Hi Alex,

Is this happening on all videos? the extension on that image looks wrong (.pjpeg)

This is obv. a bug but wondered if it's a red herrign or the root of the problem (ie. are other images fine)

thanks

btw. we are rewriting all this code for the redesigned site, so although we obviously need to iron out serious bugs, it may make sense for us to put effort into getting it working on the redesigned site rather than fixing the current code (*obviously* serious bugs need fixing on the current site, and not being able to publish sounds pretty serious to me - I was more referring to the case that this is just due to the wrong extension)

I think that the page IS being published properly, but that the approval screen is then trying to reload it but ... can't because it has (necessarily) been moved from:
 news/images/uploads/uploaded-photo-2009-09-29-18-57-32.pjpeg
to
 Photos/Resized/2009/10/14/fullsize
Am checking with Michael what we can do about this.
